website_summaries.verdict: A good choice for everyday wear and for women whose top concern is price, but the fit may not work for everyone.
pros: Budget-priced maternity jeans that earn praise for the comfortable belly panel and soft, stretchy denim
cons: They may run slightly short on taller women

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT maternity pants!
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'8 and pre pregnancy weight around 145ish. I ordered Medium. I worried about ordering jeans without trying them on. However, this was the BEST purchase I could have made. I wear these daily! I haven't been pregnant in over 5 years, and I had nothing on hand to wear. Glad to see something that is modern AND comfortable AND affordable available now. A little tight at first, and after a day, they were perfection. I started wearing them around 14 or 15 weeks... I'm at 18 now. The length is great, color is awesome, and they are very comfortable. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kate Lundquist

customer_reviews.title: Ended up returning
customer_reviews.text: I read all the reviews...I hate maternity jeans...I’m on baby #4...and have yet, in 5 years of pregnancies ever found really great maternity jeans. These were no exception. They felt good going on...walked around the house in them...they were slinking down down down and I was constantly hiking them up up up. I liked the length and look of them...but I need them to be comfortable and not a yoga exercise having to keep them staying up while chasing 3 other small kids around. For the record I ordered the XL and I wear a size 16-18 normally as well as while preggers.
customer_reviews.author: Danelle Wozniakp

customer_reviews.title: For the price these jeans are great. I feel like they are more on the ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't usually write reviews but I felt the need to because these only have one review and I almost didn't order them because of that. For the price these jeans are great. I feel like they are more on the Jenning side than jeans, but that's great for comfort. I ordered the rinse and they are the exact color I wanted. I'm about 130 lbs and 6 months pregnant and ordered a small. They fit great! The only downside is the belly part seems to fit me well now so I'm not sure how they will fit as I get bigger. That part is not quite as stretchy as I would have liked. Overall can't go wrong with these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Value for Money!
customer_reviews.text: When it comes to buying maternity clothes I am not someone who is willing to spend much, especially knowing this will be last pregnancy. I am PLEASANTLY SURPRISED by how wonderful these jeans are. They are soft and do fit very well. I did order a large after reading reviews that they run somewhat small. For reference, I wear a medium in Motherhood Maternity pants and jeans. These are great value for the money! I highly recommend buying them if you are on the fence!
customer_reviews.author: Jillian Keel

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! I got the XL, normally a L would fit me but these run a little small. I’m 5’7” 200 pounds entering third trimester, these are comfortable and cute and theres enough room that I think they should last me until the end of my pregnancy
customer_reviews.author: Mallory Christenson

customer_reviews.title: Great fit! Super comfy and stay up!
customer_reviews.text: These fit perfect, and still look stylish. I am 15.5 weeks and haven't been able to zip up my jeans. These are sweet relief. The dark color looks really nice. They are thin and stretchy but don't look cheap on at all. The belly band part has elastic on the top which holds the pants up nicely. Definitely will be getting another pair. Worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Melody Y.

customer_reviews.title: Great pants!
customer_reviews.text: Why I waited until the 6th month of my 2nd (and final) pregnancy to get maternity pants is beyond me. These are comfortable, and the high belly cover makes me less self conscious. I imagine though all pants like these feel a little like they'll fall down, since they have no traditional waist band. They are flattering, don't look like maternity pants at all, and fit just how I hoped.
customer_reviews.author: colemomma

customer_reviews.title: Weak belly band!
customer_reviews.text: The fit is ok.. They're a little short for me, but I generally wear a 'long' anyways. The problem is the belly band part. Within the first hour of wear I already had 3 snags in it! It is barely stronger than nylon pantyhose material. Very loose too and by the end of the day I couldn't keep them up anymore.
customer_reviews.author: RacH

customer_reviews.title: Confused
customer_reviews.text: The sizing on these pants is a little strange. I’m 5’7 with wide hips so the fact the jean portion around the hip area did not fit correctly was not a huge surprise for me. They fit like low riders. The maternity band however was overly long. It pulls all the way up to my bra. So it’s super long in one area and not enough jean in another area. I think if you have slender hips and don’t mind a super long band these are a decent pair of jeans. I really like the material for the price and they are super cute, they just don’t fit me well at all.
customer_reviews.author: nerdrage

customer_reviews.title: Finally! Great jeans
customer_reviews.text: Finally! I’m 8 months pregnant. After lots of searching, these pants fit great! I ordered them slightly larger than what I would normally wear. The maternity band comes up high and is loose enough where it’s not cutting into my belly. They are thinner jean material and are comfy. It’s so hard to find maternity pants that fit well. For reference I’m 5’8 and about 200 pounds and ordered the XL. They will definitely last me the duration of my pregnancy with a little room to grow.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole S.

customer_reviews.title: Fit Well, but fall down ALL the time
customer_reviews.text: I liked these pants. I thought they fit well. I even added belt loops to hang work equipment from (manufacturing environment). Unfortunately, those belt loops saved me because these pants fall down ALL the time. Seriously, just walking around my house for 10 minutes I had to pull them up. If I don't pull them up every 10 minutes, they also take my underwear down with it. I think the problem is that the panel goes up too high. When that falls down to my waist line, the pants fall with it. I ordered a medium. For reference I am 5'7" and pre-pregnant weighed 135 lbs. In these pictures I was 26 weeks and weight about 155 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Meg & Brian

customer_reviews.title: Odd fit
customer_reviews.text: I knew this before purchasing, but I didn't know that it would bf e duch an uncomfortable feature: the elastic at the top isnt actually fitted or supportive. Theres a sewn band at the vevervevery top portion that squeezes me for dear life, making these pants rather uncomfortable. Since the rest of the maternity band is loose, these fall down and appear saggy frequently in the rear. I wish I'd spent a bit more for a higher quality pair since i only need one for this pregnancy.
customer_reviews.author: Girl in Japan

customer_reviews.title: Great maternity skinny jeans!
customer_reviews.text: These are great! I was really skeptical about ordering jeans online because they are selling difficult to find the right size/fit. I am 5’2, currently 22 weeks and 136 lbs. Ordered a medium and they fit very well, very flattering. The material is fitted but with some stretch/room so I am hopeful they will last my entire pregnancy. As others have mentioned, the belly band is not super tight, so you might find yourself hiking them up occasionally. Jean Material is also a bit thin so I imagine these will wear out faster than pricier jeans, but I only plan to wear them for 6 months or so anyways!
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Good for specific body shape
customer_reviews.text: These don’t work for me but they’d be perfect for shorter pregnant people who carry their non-pregnancy weight in their middles (like apple-shaped folks). I carry my weight in my legs, so these fit my legs great but were gigantic around my waist and belly. Also not as long as I’d prefer. I got the 3X (I go up a size for skinny cut pants), normally an 18/2X, 5’4”, 230 at 23 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Ms Sharon Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Slide down like no other!
customer_reviews.text: I was really hoping the reviews weren't wrong on these, but holy slide down! And why on earth would ya'll make jeggings tight in the thighs/crotch? Absolutely no stretch. Make them less like jeans and more like leggings and they'll stay up. Seriously so sad that my Motherhood jeggings ripped in the thigh, because they know how to do maternity jeggings! Last month in my pregnancy and I was really hoping these would work out for the last two weeks of work, going to be annoying as all hell now!!
customer_reviews.author: MSH

customer_reviews.title: More jeggings than jeans
customer_reviews.text: These were all jeggings, not skinny jeans, which would be great except I ordered jeans. They were comfortable in the legs but fit oddly in the seat. And even in the trying-on process with about five minutes of wear, they went from holding a jean shape to wrinkles that didn't smooth out even after I took them off. I ended up buying a great pair of skinny jeans from Target that were totally worth the extra $13.
customer_reviews.author: S. Schupska

customer_reviews.title: Sags slightly but comfortable and worth it!
customer_reviews.text: These jeans are super comfortable! They were a little tight around the legs at first but stretched out to a comfortable point after less than 30 mins of wearing them. I’m 5’5” 157lbs and 24 weeks pregnant for size measurements! The only unfortunate part is the jeans constantly bag and I find myself having to pull them up more often than I should have to..which wasn’t much of a surprise since I had read other reviews with the same problem! Overall I’m happy with my purchase and honestly for the price might end up buying more.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Not flattering or comfy
customer_reviews.text: These pants did not fit well, I actually never wore them because when I put them on they were so uncomfortable and unflattering. The crotch seemed to sag and the material was itchy. I ended up getting some from Walmart that I loved and wore my entire pregnancy
customer_reviews.author: Brandy D

customer_reviews.title: Long but comfy
customer_reviews.text: Overall these are great maternity jeans. I’m 5’5” and 138 lbs currently at 3 months pregnant and I got a medium. Obviously I don’t need maternity jeans yet but I was being proactive. They are long, I have to roll them twice at the ankle for them to be at my ankle bone and they seem a little wide at my hips. The band feels tight though like it’ll hold once my belly gets big and right now it goes up all the way over my boobs haha I love the dark color and it’s nice it has 4 functional pockets!
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Jeans fit but feel a little low cut
customer_reviews.text: I’m 5’1 and 5 months pregnant. I’m slightly curvy, like most Hispanic women. When I tried on the jeans it fit around the belly, length was good for my height, and fit my bottom good. However, it felt slightly tight around the thighs. I did all kinds of movements(dance, sit down, squat, etc) in them and it felt a little funny around the thigh area. The jean fabric ended slightly below my hip and that felt funny. This is probably a good fit for someone with slim legs who likes to wear low cut jeans.
customer_reviews.author: Anais Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Saggy crotch
customer_reviews.text: They are so cute and fit great except from mid thigh to pelvis... I couldn't wear them. The other reviews were right about them being tight yet loose and saggy crotch with only taking a few steps in them. Weird design but would have been perfect except for that. I'm a medium in everything pre-pregnancy and now am 155 5'6'' and have a huge pregnancy belly at 22weeks. If you have larger thighs medium would definitely be too small since that is where they start to get weird.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Bacsik

customer_reviews.title: I love how these jeans fit and feel
customer_reviews.text: I love how these jeans fit and feel. The size is true to what is stated. However, within a week of wearing them, they began to get tiny tears in them. I think it's from the material stretching when pulling them up. I wouldn't mind if they blended in, but they are white tears against a dark fabric. Now I can only wear these jeans if I have a very long shirt on top.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Wenger

customer_reviews.title: Not all bad but not all good.
customer_reviews.text: I returned these, but it wasn’t all bad. I liked the rinse although it was darker than expected. The length was the main reason for returning. They were too long to deal with. Fabric has no stretch. If the jeans had a bit of stretch I would totally have kept it. It cut on my lower hips under the belly portion. The belly seemed to have more give rather than compression stretch like I prefer on my belly. The search continues for the perfect maternity jeans. I’m a plus bottom 16/18 ordered xl
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Pretty darn comfy
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty comfy. I’m about 6 foot and these sit a little above the ankle, but it looks like that’s on purpose. Bought these for work at a out 16 weeks, I’m at 25 now and they’re still going strong. I’m pretty active during work hours and these do great. The only problem is the lack of fit consistency between the colors. I bought 3 pairs in different colors and one pair slides down all day giving me diaper crotch.
customer_reviews.author: Meghan

customer_reviews.title: Great fit!
customer_reviews.text: These jeans were very comfortable and they fit very well! I'm petite and 6.5 months pregnant. I'm usually a XS and got these in a S. Planning on ordering another one in a M since i'll definetly grow more. Overall great pair of jeans for the price. Was definetly surprised!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, but not my perfect fit...
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing these jeans for about four months through my pregnancy, and to their credit, they have grown and stretched with my just fine. My only exception with them is that they don't quite fit how I would like in the seat of the pants. They work well for the most part, but definitely ride down as I move around during the day. I find myself having to constantly pull them up and reposition them. Overall though, they have been good and are definitely worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Sloan

customer_reviews.title: Incorrectly Sewn / Lopsided Seam
customer_reviews.text: I would have loved these pants due to the color and fit in the legs if it weren't for 2 things: 1). the pants were incorrectly sewn and the seam in the rear is lopsided. The pants shift to one side of my butt check, making it look like I have a lopsided butt (which I don't have); 2). these fell down very easily. The waistline (not the belly elastic) was too loose in the hips. I felt like I needed to keep pulling these up whenever I walked, which was difficult since there aren't any belt loops to use to pull them up.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney M

customer_reviews.title: Good but band to tight.
customer_reviews.text: These jeans are wonderful. Reason why I took one star away is because the band is way too tight. I had bought a larger size but had to return it because the fit around my legs was too big. The medium size fit well except for the band. Am pregnant with twins and not sure how long I'll be using these because of the band. Am currently at work now and I had to make some cuts to the band so it could lossen up a bit. Even then it didn't help.
customer_reviews.author: LBSAA

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I usually just leave reviews when I'm mad or dissatisfied, but ladies these are amazing . I'm tall and thinner , 15 weeks pregnant , these are amazing ! A must have . Affordable and comfortable. Don't spend 80$ on a pair, these a worth it!
customer_reviews.author: jessica

customer_reviews.title: Not very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I gave it 3 stars because the placement of the jeans does not fit right on the hips. The belly band starts at the hip while I feel the jean material slipping lower than my hip. I constantly have to pull it up to make it feel comfortable. When I sit down it slides down to my butt. It is not comfortable to move around in. And not very stretchy/breathable Jean material. I just use it now if my other maternity pants are on the wash.
customer_reviews.author: Jen T.

customer_reviews.title: Rumor Has It Super Soft Stretch Skinny Jeans
customer_reviews.text: A lot of other reviews mention that the elastic top is too big, I find that from the knee up these fit fine. From the knee down they're way too long and weirdly wide. I have them rolled up three times and they're still baggy at the ankles. Definitely not skinny jeans, and I wouldn't buy from this brand again. I wear a size 14/16 before pregnancy and bought an XL.
customer_reviews.author: mominatrixx

customer_reviews.title: Too big AND too small!
customer_reviews.text: I got the XL and these are extremely low cut and tight around the thighs and super baggy around the knees. I look ridiculous in these and when I walk they fall off. These jeans are not put together with the female body in mind, especially not a pregnant one. I do not recommend these jeans unless you're slim and like low rise pants.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine & Tim

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: Usually about a medium in normal clothes but found that lately I’ve fit into smalls for maternity so i tried a small. They were wayyyy too small. Could barely get them over my thighs. I returned them and found a small pair of pants at another store that i was able to try on for the same price as these. Probably wouldn’t recommend buying maternity pants online. IMO
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too short and small for someone who's tall
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'9" and these were too short for me. In addition, as other reviewers said, there's no give where the top of the main part of the pants meets the stretchy stomach fabric, so it awkwardly digs in below your waist. I'll be returning these - the quest for good maternity jeans continues!
customer_reviews.author: MRB

customer_reviews.title: Had to order a size up
customer_reviews.text: It was very tight when I ordered my pre-pregnancy size as suggested, so I had to order a size up. Otherwise these are pretty good. The only annoying thing about them is they can be a little saggy around the back and belly. I expect as my baby grows it will fit better. I am currently 7 months.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Ottaviano

customer_reviews.title: Extremely loose
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a large based on reviews and these pants are very loose; I’m 35 weeks pregnant and 5”6, and I’m not small, and the pants are very loose around the legs, and the material that comes up over my prego bump is so loose I tuck it under my bra to keep it up. I should’ve ordered a medium.
customer_reviews.author: Charlene

customer_reviews.title: Prefect pregnancy jeans
customer_reviews.text: My before pregnancy weight and height were 5' 6'' and 119lbs. This is my 3rd pregnancy. The clothes from my first two pregnancies are not as comfortable this time. I hate wearing leggings, and these jeans are soft, stretchy and look great! I got a size medium because I am only 22 weeks and know that I will still gain about 10-15 lbs before my due date. At 129lbs now (22weeks), size medium is perfect - stretchy, not tight. I still have room to grow!
customer_reviews.author: EMA

customer_reviews.title: not a fan
customer_reviews.text: I'm not loving these & will probably send back. first of all, I ordered the dark & received dark but the thighs have a bleach design on them & not what I ordered. I'm also 5'3 & these are very baggy at the ankles. I was expecting tight fit around my ankles & there are not.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke T.

customer_reviews.title: Nest maternity pants I've found yet!
customer_reviews.text: I am 5'8" , 190 lbs, 16 weeks pregnant and normally wear a size 14. I ordered the XL so I had some room to grow. These pants fit perfectly and should last me the whole pregnancy. The belly is stretchy which give some room to grow. With a shirt to cover the top portion of the pants you cant even tell they are maternity pants. Extremely comfortable and fit perfectly everywhere. I dont like sweat pants or yoga pants so it was hard for me to find Jean's that looked normal and would grow with me but, these pants worked perfectly. I definitely will be buying more.
customer_reviews.author: Kitty 😺

customer_reviews.title: Great fit!
customer_reviews.text: I'm at 1 - 2 in jeans normally, and these fit like a glove. Good length, perfect dark color, and the belly band fits snug at the top with elastic. I'm only 14 weeks now, so there's a little room in the hips too grow - which is great! Will most likely buy another pair of these today. Awesome product!
customer_reviews.author: Jeshicurr

customer_reviews.title: They run small and then shrink in the wash
customer_reviews.text: They fit snugly, but jeans normally stretch out after wearing all day. Not these. Then after a few washes in cool water and tumbled dry at low heat, they shrank and are impossible to wear. That's what I get for trying to save money and buy cheap clothes.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah F.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I love these! I hate shopping for Jean's or jeggings and shopping for them. I'm 5'6, longer legs than torso, and about 140 pounds at 6 months along. I ordered a medium and they fit perfect! The 6 month mark of pregnancy doest make you feel like you look the greatest but these are actually flattering and super comfortable. The belly band section could be a little more snug and it does slide down a tad, but for the price I'm super happy!!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Shotliff

customer_reviews.title: size Medium and it fits perfectly and super soft! The belly panel feels so comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I bought the pait of jeans in color Medium, size Medium and it fits perfectly and super soft! The belly panel feels so comfortable. Definitely a great buy for the price. I'm buying another pair in color Rinse!
customer_reviews.author: Tram Anh

customer_reviews.title: Very weird fit; disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Product fit is very unusual. I'm not a large person; first baby, athletic build. Ankles were so tight I could barely put the pants on, thighs were super tight constantly pulling pants down, and hips were so loose I tried sewing in over an inch and 1/4 in each side to keep them up, but even that wasn't enough. Simply can't wear these
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Cute look, but slide down.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like these maternity pant. They are made like jeggings, but I am having difficulty keeping them up. they tend to slide down- If I got them any smaller I wouldn't be able to fit them over my thighs. They are cute- but fit my body oddly.
customer_reviews.author: Becca R.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect length for tall women!!
customer_reviews.text: Being 5'10 I feel I have to advocate for tall women. I'm currently 36 weeks pregnant. Pre pregnancy weight was 158, current weight gain is 38 pounds and I'm so happy I found these pants. Great value and these are way longer than any other pair of maternity pants I've found. I'm happy I have a pair of jeans to throw in the mix as I've only been wearing leggings for the past month and that's just not my style. Wish I would've found these sooner.
customer_reviews.author: michelle egan

customer_reviews.title: Not too shabby & REAL front pockets
customer_reviews.text: Great maternity pants to grow into. For reference I'm 5 1/2 months pregnant and just over 120 lbs at 5'2". Pre pregnancy wore 25 jeans or 0. These didn't fit at first and were really loose around the crotch area so bad that I wouldn't wear them, but I grew into them recently, new go to and they have actual front pockets that are deep! Super plus
customer_reviews.author: Angela D.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible fit & horrible quality. Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: These pants are awful. They are way too long and the fit is all over the place. I ended up throwing them out. They would fall down on me as I walked and just did not look good at all. Total waste of money. Do not buy. You are way better off buying maternity jeans at Target, GAP or Motherhood...basically anywhere but Amazon. These truly are trash.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Loose stitching that ripped after only a couple washes
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: After a second wash more holes have appeared in the seams of the fabric that comes up over your belly. I’ve only had these for three weeks and feel they should hold up a lot better than that.. Great jeans except the belly band started separating from the jeans after the first wash and now has a hole on the band so that was disappointing. Loose threads maybe. Other than that the fit is pretty good and jeans are comfortable
customer_reviews.author: JoSto719

customer_reviews.title: Long and comfy
customer_reviews.text: They look pretty good and I like how there’s elastic at the top to keep them up and not all over the belly part - like some maternity pants. But they are like SUPER LONG. I’m 5’7’’ and had to cuff them twice so they would be above my shoes. But I think the cuffs are cute and I’d much rather them be too long than too short.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Haywood

customer_reviews.title: Little tight
customer_reviews.text: I would order a size up from what you actually are. Normally I wear an eight, I’m barley pregnant but a little bloated that’s why I ordered these, and they’re definitely a little too snug for my comfort. My size eight jeans are a little loose around the thigh area so I thought I’d be fine ordering the same size.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: Brought a small, fits way too big!!
customer_reviews.text: These pants aren't made for those of us who only grow in the belly area. I'm 21 weeks pregnant and gained 10 pounds that have only went to the stomach area. The rest of my body is exactly the same size as pre-pregnancy. These pants are not only super baggy but they are super long. The material that stretches over the stomach practically covered half my chest and I'm 5'1. Horribly made and very disappointed. Will be sending them back.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cute but too big
customer_reviews.text: Probably an overestimate on my end, but the pants are definitely way larger than I expected. Typically, since becoming pregnant for the second time in 12 months (yayyy Irish twins lol), I’m an XL in most clothing - so I ordered these in an XL. They’re definitely too large, but hopefully they shrink up in the wash.
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, not too much stretch.
customer_reviews.text: I love how these maternity jeans look on me! I usually go for Levi’s anyway, just because of their nice fit. They have just enough stretch without stretching out throughout the day. No issues with them falling down. The belly band part did stretch out a tiny bit at the very top, but hasn’t affected anything. I’m sure it’ll go back to normal after wash.
customer_reviews.author: SPickslay

customer_reviews.title: Follow the size guide
customer_reviews.text: I followed other reviewers advise and sized up, but really shouldn’t have. I’m normally a size 18 so I bought the 2x (size 20-22) and they were pretty baggy. I can’t fault the seller for that, had I followed their size recommendations the pants would have been perfect. They are soft and the band gives lots of room for growing (I’m 22 weeks along).
customer_reviews.author: Amanda B.

customer_reviews.title: Nice jeans but not for cold weather
customer_reviews.text: I am revising my initial review because the company contacted me quickly about the defective product I received. Today I received a brand new pair of pants that are in perfect condition. They are still very thin jeans but the seams are smooth and there are no holes in the panel as before. I would recommend these for warmer weather, not winter time. I am glad the company takes the time to check reviews and respond to the negative ones. Great customer service!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking pants with actual pockets!
customer_reviews.text: I really like these pants. I love that they have real pockets in front as well as the back. The over the belly part doesn't quite come up high enough for me to go over my stomach and feels uncomfortable after wearing them for a day. They look great though!
customer_reviews.author: Emileigh

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your time
customer_reviews.text: As far as jeggings go this would totally work it they weren’t maternity and if i wasn’t pregnant. I’m a size 12/14 I ordered a L in this color and an xl in the light blue. It’s like day and night. If you want your pants falling down on you but don’t come above your waist.. this are the jeans for you.
customer_reviews.author: Farren

customer_reviews.title: Love these!!
customer_reviews.text: I am 5'9" and trying to find maternity jeans at target or local store is hard because the pants are high waters on me (an not the good kind). These hit right below my ankle and fit great! So happy to find these and want to order more! Also the coloring is great. Very cute. Oh and they have pockets!!! So they look very normal :)
customer_reviews.author: SmartMomma2011

customer_reviews.title: Favorite preger pants! Comfy, cute, and best deal!
customer_reviews.text: Loved these! I bought this brand and one other and I'm buying another one of these because they were perfect. Comfy, stay up, good wash color, perfect fit, and not bulky like other preger pants can be. I'm 5ft 6 and 145 lbs at 24 weeks and ordered a medium, wear them all the time and they don't give me mom butt or squeeze my growing belly 😂
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Odd Sizing
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a medium as that was my pre-pregnancy size, too tight. Sent back and ordered a large. Ended up fitting in the waist and thighs but very baggy in the knee and calf area. I was hoping for a more fitted, skinny jean look. I'm washing them in hopes that they will shrink a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Ashlyn

customer_reviews.title: Fits as expected but slide down.
customer_reviews.text: At 12 weeks pregnant, my regular pants do not fit anymore so I thought these would be perfect. The size guide is correct, I purchased a medium and the do fit. However, the biggest issue I’m finding with maternity jeans is that they fall down. Sure you have the panel that goes over your belly but there’s nothing on the waist to keep it from slipping. Just walking around they slowly move down and it’s not so simple to pull them up without lifting your shirt to grab the panel and hike back up creating quite a scene lol. Maybe my belly isn’t big enough yet but right now they’re not the most comfortable pants.
customer_reviews.author: Danielleyfresh

customer_reviews.title: They’re ok
customer_reviews.text: Wear a size 18 and got the 1x which fits good in hips and thighs but a bit baggy in calves. I can see how these will start falling down after walking in them a bit tho. First pair of pregnancy jeans I’ve tried though so nothing to compare to.
customer_reviews.author: HH

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth the Buy
customer_reviews.text: These maternity jeans are cute but extremely tight on the legs. And once you wiggle them on, they continunally fall down. Im 5'6 and currently 220lbs and 6 months pregnant. I wore these 3 thimes and every time I spent the day pulling up my pants over AND over again. I would not buy again or reccomand you buy either.
customer_reviews.author: McKenna

customer_reviews.title: Not for curvy women
customer_reviews.text: I had to return these pants. I didn’t like them much at all. I carry my weight in my thighs and my butt. These pants seem to have been made for someone that is less curvy. They could have been worn, but they were not flattering since there was so much extra fabric that grouped together under my butt. Overall, not happy. I don’t think a different size would have made a difference. I think it just didn’t work with my body shape.
customer_reviews.author: Jeran/Kayla Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Liked, but adjusting often.
customer_reviews.text: These don’t stay up as well as I had hoped. It does have the belly crossover, so that helps, but I feel like I am constantly pulling them up at the hips. The calves are a little tight but I do have larger calves. I think these just don’t offer about stretch in the fabric.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: They were pretty cheap so I guess I can't really complain but the tags are in a really inconvenient place so I had to cut them out or deal with the itching. I normally wear a size 7 in jeans so I ordered a size small hoping that would keep them from falling down but it didn't. I was worried about length because some of the reviews said the jeans are short but I'm 5'7 and they're perfect. I'll probably still wear them instead of buying another pair so they aren't completely awful or anything.
customer_reviews.author: hannah

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable fit. However, the bottoms of the pants are little loose. I have to have them taken in at the ankles....they look a little loosie goosie and sorta funny. I expect these pants to fit comfortably from beginning to end and beyond.
customer_reviews.author: Natasha D

customer_reviews.title: Price could be lowered, based off quality.
customer_reviews.text: Comfy Every day comfy Good for while it last. Price should definitely go lower. The quality is not top notch so the price should be lower like $9.99 If you're the seller, please lower the price a bit. Price gauging.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't even get the jeans past my knees. I always get a size bigger when purchasing jeans (even when not pregnant) just because my thighs are a little bigger, but these SO did not work. I am giving 2 stars because I really liked the texture/feel of the jeans. I may try ordering again, but I hate to order almost 2 sizes bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Callie

customer_reviews.title: Not true to size
customer_reviews.text: The difference between the large and the extra large is staggering. The extra large fits like a 2x. And the large fits like a medium.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not denim material and thinner fabric than expected but ...
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not denim material and thinner fabric than expected but it is soft and stretchy to wear. The sizing chart was accurate for me using pre-pregnancy sizing. I would order again for the pricing.
customer_reviews.author: Akayen

customer_reviews.title: Nice pants, I would recommend them!
customer_reviews.text: These pants are a good quality for the price. They are comfortable and fit slightly big now. I am 4 month pregnant now, so they should work until the end of my pregnancy. The color is also nice.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Slusher

customer_reviews.title: How are these skinny jeans?
customer_reviews.text: These are terrible. They fit awkward at the waist and I would definitely not call them skinny jeans. There were very very baggy throughout the whole leg, especially at the ankle. I could not get a smaller size as the waist was already a bit tight - and I'm only 8 weeks along. If you are looking for a comfy maternity jegging, skip these. I'll be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Kmvr

customer_reviews.title: Nice material, a little too large
customer_reviews.text: I like the feel of the jean material But they sagged a bit in the back. I’m usually in a 2X but the jeans were a tad too big. And I am thicker in the thighs so it fit well in that area. Belly band stopped under my breast
customer_reviews.author: LaKeah Parker

customer_reviews.title: Runs Small
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised these jeans were to small for me when I ordered them because I previously ordered Rumor Has It maternity pants in the same size and they fit perfect! I am in the process of returning them.
customer_reviews.author: Jake or Hosanna

customer_reviews.title: Cute but short
customer_reviews.text: I love the color on these but the waistband doesn’t stay up. Hopefully as the belly grows it will stay in place. They’re also long capris for me at 5’11
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Burns

customer_reviews.title: Decent Maternity Jeans for the Price
customer_reviews.text: My wife bought 2 pair of these over the course of her pregnancy. The first pair fit as expected. She ordered her pre-pregnancy size (small). The second pair (same exact item) are loose in the legs and become baggy in the knees while wearing them. Overall, they are decent maternity jeans for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Len

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for tall ladies
customer_reviews.text: My pregnant daughter is a server and we have been searching for a perfect length to fit a 6 mo belly. My daughter was over when the delivery came and put them on and started to cry because she was so stressed working in uncomfortable pants... they are perfect!! She is 5’9 tall skinny and belly
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not too bad, not overly great either.
customer_reviews.text: I think these are ok for the price. They were advertised as “stretchy,” but they really aren’t stretchy at all. I do like the full coverage top - very comfortable and I found kept the pants from sliding down. I only need them to work for 3 months, and I think they’ll be perfect for that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 3 jr jeans or a size 2-4 in woman's I am 5'5 122 pounds.. I am now 9 weeks pregnant 127 pounds (small bloaty bump going on) and the size small fit. They are a tiny bit tight on my thighs but have some stretch. They make my booty look good too which is a plus!!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Size extra large gets super baggy
customer_reviews.text: The size large that I ordered was a good shape but was too small I am 5 10 and 180 pounds and 15 weeks pregnant. When I got the bigger size they were super baggy and wide after you get past the bum.
customer_reviews.author: Danyelle Sorensen

customer_reviews.title: Weird fit
customer_reviews.text: I have a short torso so the belly band went all the way to my breasts. Not really the issue. For the most part, the fit was good but they were so Uncomfortably loose in my calves. I ordered skinny jeans, not relaxed straight leg fit. Thin material. You get what you pay for I suppose.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy Dean

customer_reviews.title: Best maternity jeans
customer_reviews.text: I love these! I bought a pair from old navy but I hated them. These are soft, comfy, and cute!! They lifted my butt and are actually skinny at the ankle, which is super important to me. They are a little long, but honestly most jeans are on me. Before pregnancy, I only wore AE jeggings and I would say these are pretty comparable for maternity jeans at least! I’m six months pregnant, on the heavier side, and I ordered a size large. They definitely start out tighter, but stretch to fit perfectly. I’m planning on buying more!
customer_reviews.author: Peighton

customer_reviews.title: Ok but more jean feeling than I was hoping for
customer_reviews.text: These are ok, they defiantly feel more like a cheap jean material. The stretchy part above the belly is very big and kind lose so I feel like I have to pull them up often. They fit pretty well in the leg area and I have plenty of room to grow in them even at 30 weeks. I am 5'5 currently 170lbs at 30weeks.
customer_reviews.author: alyssa

customer_reviews.title: good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these pants for work. they are good for the price. I am a very curvy girl so my hips are large. they are snug in my hips but seem to fit well everywhere else. I do roll them into ankle pants most of the time so the length isn't an issue for me. I have 2 pair.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Riddle

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product - highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love this product! I was able to wear my regulag jeans throughout my entire pregnancy thanks to these - they hid the fact that my pants were unbuttoned and looked like a tank top hanging out the bottom of my shirt. They do run large as other reviews mention so go at least 1 size down from your normal if not 2 sizes
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Larger than expected, but plenty of space for ladies that have thicker legs.
customer_reviews.text: If you have wider hips and legs, it may be perfect for you. They got a little too largely for mine, which is surprising since I have quite large quads due to working out. The belly on the pants has plenty of space and stretch, but was too large for me. They would not stay above my wide hips.
customer_reviews.author: Baker

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable but didn’t last. I got 2 pairs and both started coming apart at the seams after less than 2 months. I got another 2 pairs- same thing happened.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia Ackman

customer_reviews.title: Okay...
customer_reviews.text: For maternity pants they work. They are very baggy in the butt and legs. Ride down a lot. I would buy a size down if I bought them again. All other maternity pants are an XL, wish I would have bought a large
customer_reviews.author: Jacq

customer_reviews.title: Not skinny jean as pictured
customer_reviews.text: I'm usually a size 12-14 in Jean's. I bought the XL. They fit great in thigh but then fall straight from knee down. I bought expecting a skinny jean as pictured. Did not get that. Will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: The fit was horrible
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'9 and there was about 4 inches of jean material around my ankles. They were boot cut and not skinny jeans. I bought from the same seller a pair in black and they fit perfect and were exactly as described. I didn't try them on in time to return them so I am stuck with a pair of jeans I can't wear because the hips are super tight even though I bought them in a size larger than I normally wear.
customer_reviews.author: Breeeee

customer_reviews.title: Actually fit!
customer_reviews.text: I have a thin form and am only gaining weight in my belly so it's been hard to find maternity pants that are still fitted. These age fitted with the belly band for over the belly for the belly to grow!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Wetsch

customer_reviews.title: They fit great! I’m a size 8-10 in regular jeans
customer_reviews.text: They fit great! I’m a size 8-10 in regular jeans. Ordered the Medium size and it fits amazing. Very stretchy too. I will definitely be ordering more!
customer_reviews.author: sarah

customer_reviews.title: Not for thick thighs
customer_reviews.text: These are okay - the full panel is comfy but not very tight; the thighs are way too tight. Not my favorite pair of maternity pants. Wish the panel would have been made with a thicker elastic.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Fits great and in comfortable with room to grow.
customer_reviews.text: I don't normally write reviews but these are so awesome I have too. I am always worried about getting something to small. This fits perfect for me! It isn't snug at all with lots of room to grow. I ordered a medium. I am 5'1 and 130 pounds and currently 15 weeks pregnant. Good job guys!
customer_reviews.author: Nexteyem

customer_reviews.title: Small
customer_reviews.text: These pants are a bit too tight and fit pretty small. They worked while I needed them though. But being pregnant you kind of gained a little bit of weight so they didn't last very long.
customer_reviews.author: JessB4

customer_reviews.title: Do. Not. Buy.
customer_reviews.text: No, just don’t. Just like everyone else said these pants fell down all day. The crotch of these pants kept staying about a inch and a half away low all day. I was pulling them up every time I walked.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Lee

customer_reviews.title: Medium dark maternity jeans
customer_reviews.text: I was in a car accident a year ago and had 14 surgeries on my abdomen and can only wear maternity jeans until I get reconstructive surgery. I have two pair of these jeans - exactly the same.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Townsend

customer_reviews.title: not skinny jeans!
customer_reviews.text: I got them in an XL and they are basically wide leg at the bottom, not skinny! super annoying bc they fit normally everywhere else. if you are getting a bigger size don’t expect skinny fit!
customer_reviews.author: SJ2016

product_meta.title: RUMOR HAS IT Maternity Over The Belly Super Soft Stretch Skinny Jeans
feature_bullets: Custom built over the belly panel that supports your growing bump
Super soft and stretchy denim for maximum comfort
Classic skinny silhouette that complements your body
